Title: Binomial theorem proof for rational index without calculus
Content:
I have tried to find a proof of the binomial theorem for any power, but I am finding it difficult. One can obviously prove the integer index case using induction, but all of the approaches for ANY power seem to involve calculus usually the Maclaurin series. My point is that surely as the result 
$$\frac{d}{dx}(x^n)=nx^{n-1}$$
relies on the binomial theorem when taking the limit, this means that any attempt to prove the binomial theorem using calculus is circular. 
Is there a proof without calculus for ANY power?
